articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Syrians awakened on Monday to a hopeful if uncertain future, after rebels seized the capital Damascus and President Bashar al-Assad fled to Russia, ending a 13-year civil war and more than 50 years of his family's brutal rule.
articles.title: With Assad ousted, a new era starts in Syria as the  world watches

articles.author: Jonathan Spicer, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: They sensed an opportunity about six months ago when they felt they received Turkey's tacit approval for a major offensive, two sources said.
articles.title: How stars aligned for Syria's rebels to oust Assad

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: The commander of South Korea's special forces that stormed parliament last week after a martial law declaration said on Monday he was ordered to block lawmakers from entering the chamber to prevent a vote to lift the emergency measure.
articles.title: South Korea special forces officer says he had orders to block lawmakers

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: Australian police on Monday transferred an investigation into an arson attack on a Melbourne synagogue to a joint counter-terrorism unit, saying the blaze was likely a terrorist attack.
articles.title: Australia police say synagogue arson attack likely terrorist incident

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinian health officials said on Sunday that Israeli forces had shelled the Kamal Adwan Hospital in the northern Gaza town of Beit Lahiya, damaging electricity and oxygen pumps and disrupting urgent surgeries.
articles.title: Israel shells north Gaza hospital, disrupting service, doctors say

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: His statement prompted Volodymyr Zelenskiy and the Kremlin to list their conditions.
articles.title: Trump calls for immediate Ukraine ceasefire

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: An amended lawsuit filed in federal court on Sunday alleges that rap mogul Jay-Z raped a 13-year-old girl along with Sean "Diddy" Combs during a party in 2000.
articles.title: Rapper Jay-Z accused in lawsuit of raping 13-year-old girl

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump aims to deport all immigrants in the U.S. illegally over his four-year term but also wants a deal later to protect so-called "Dreamer" immigrants, he said in an interview that aired on Sunday on NBC News' “Meet the Press with Kristen Welker.”
articles.title: Trump says he aims to deport all immigrants in the US illegally

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A seismic event sparked a fire and halted operations at the Alardinskaya mine in southwestern Siberia, Russian officials and news agencies said on Monday.
articles.title: Seismic event sparks fire, stops operations at Russian coal mine

articles.author: Kate Abnett, Alison Withers
articles.description: This year will be the world's warmest since records began, with extraordinarily high temperatures expected to persist into at least the first few months of 2025, European Union scientists said on Monday.
articles.title: 2024 will be the hottest year on record, EU scientists say
